lines.text: I resolve never to do a dishonest act, or take part in any thieving, robbing, or false undertaking. I will always keep to the straight and narrow, so help me God. It's still a sunny day.
I'd like to get my hands around the throat of the son of a bitch that told me to go west.

[Talking to the posse that's about to hang him]
I'll tell ya boys... I'm the oldest whore on the block.
[Drew and Jake are about to enter a life of crime... ]
Say, how'd that Jane Eyre turn out?
Fine. Just fine.
[to bank patrons]
Stick 'em up.
You go ahead and eat your beans, Joe. Me and the boys can take 'em easy. There's only two.
My boy, if it was a blind woman in a wheelchair, I'd still give her the odds.
Damn, Jackson, I wouldn't mind you being so stupid if you was good company, but you ain't even that!

My boy, let me give you a little piece of advice. If you're going to pull a gun on somebody, which happens from time to time in these parts, you better fire it about a half a second after you do it... because most men aren't as patient as I am.
Boys, it was hell on wheels. The worst idea in the world to go west.
Oh, come on now.

No, I ain't lying to you, son. We tried farming the first year and a twister wiped us out. Next year it was the cattlemen, then just pure-D rotten soil. There ain't nobody got no money excepting a few. And even if you do have, there ain't a thing worth having. It rains so much it will give you the chilblains. A dry spell comes along and you choke to death on dust. That is if a bushwhacker don't come along and take your last damn dollar. No, I mean it boys, turn around and go back!
I've got two dollars and no sense.

[Mockingly]
Just like you, Simms!

[Trying to restrain Drew]
You may not look like much, but you're a real tiger, ain't yuh?

[Dying with a smoking gunshot wound in his neck]
I'm dead! The little rat got me!

[Narrating]
I killed and ate a skunk today. Taste didn't much enter into it.
Chaw?

[Lighting his pipe]
When I want to chew on horseshit, I'll let you know.

[to the runaways]
Goodbye, boys. Just think of us as some terrible nightmare that came and went. By nightfall you'll forget we were ever here.
Marshall, you wouldn't want it on your conscience that you hung an innocent man!
Get outta here, kid. I wanna go to bed.
Yahooo! Whoop! Whooo! That was a deal! Whoo!
Are you done already?
I do not waste my time mister. After that ride I gave her, I expect she'll be too tuckered out for the rest of you boys.
